techmeme.title: Amazon expands Haul, its Temu competitor, to offer name-brand items from Amazon's US inventory, as the US plans to end de minimis tariff exemptions on May 2 (Theo Wayt/The Information)
Google says Deep Research is now available on Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental for Gemini Advanced subscribers (Abner Li/9to5Google)
Aurascape, which offers enterprise security tools to mitigate risks from third-party AI apps, emerges from stealth with $50M from Menlo, Mayfield, and others (Ryan Naraine/SecurityWeek)
Source: Instagram is working on an iPad app, and Adam Mosseri told staff to be willing to assume more "risk" to take advantage of a potential TikTok ban (The Information)
Germany-based Hawk, which offers AI-powered anti-money laundering services, raised a $56M Series C led by One Peak and says it has over 80 customers worldwide (Cameron Emanuel-Burns/FinTech Futures)
